item.text: After this Paul departed from Athens and went to Corinth.

There he<n id="1" /> <st data-num="2147" class="">found</st><n id="2" /> a <st data-num="2453" class="">Jew</st> <st data-num="3686" class="">named</st> <st data-num="207" class="">Aquila</st>,<n id="3" /> a <st data-num="1085" class="">native</st> of <st data-num="4193" class="">Pontus</st>,<n id="4" /> who had <st data-num="4373" class="">recently</st> <st data-num="2064" class="">come</st> <st data-num="575" class="">from</st> <st data-num="2482" class="">Italy</st> with <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="1135" class="">wife</st> <st data-num="4251">Priscilla</st>, <st data-num="1223" class="">because</st> <st data-num="2804" class="">Claudius</st><n id="5" /> had <st data-num="1299" class="">ordered</st> <st data-num="3956" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews</st> to <st data-num="5563" class="">depart</st> <st data-num="575" class="">from</st><n id="6" /> <st data-num="4516" class="">Rome</st>.<n id="7" /> Paul <st data-num="4334" class="">approached</st><n id="8" /> <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>,

<st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1223" class="">because</st> he <st data-num="3673">worked at the same trade</st>, he <st data-num="3306" class="">stayed</st> <st data-num="3844" class="">with</st> <st data-num="846" class="">them</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="2038" class="">worked</st> with them<n id="1" /> (<st data-num="1063">for</st> they <st data-num="1510" class="">were</st> <st data-num="4635" class="">tentmakers</st><n id="2" /> by <st data-num="5078" class="">trade)</st>.<n id="3" />
He addressed both Jews and Greeks in the synagogue every Sabbath, attempting to persuade them.
Now when Silas and Timothy arrived from Macedonia, Paul became wholly absorbed with proclaiming the word, testifying to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ.

When <st data-num="846" class="">they</st> <st data-num="498" class="">opposed</st> him<n id="1" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="987" class="">reviled</st> him,<n id="2" /> he protested by <st data-num="1621">shaking out</st> his <st data-num="2440" class="">clothes</st><n id="3" /> and <st data-num="3004">said</st> <st data-num="4314">to</st> <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>, “<st data-num="4771" class="">Your</st> <st data-num="129" class="">blood</st><n id="4" /> be <st data-num="1909" class="">on</st> <st data-num="4771">your</st> own <st data-num="2776" class="">heads</st>! <st data-num="1473" class="">I</st> am <st data-num="2513" class="">guiltless</st>!<n id="5" /> <st data-num="575" class="">From</st> <st data-num="3568" class="">now</st> on <st data-num="1473" class="">I</st> will <st data-num="4198" class="">go</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="1484" class="">Gentiles</st>!”

<st data-num="2532" class="">Then</st> Paul<n id="1" /> <st data-num="3327" class="">left</st><n id="2" /> the synagogue<n id="3" /> and <st data-num="1525">went to</st> the <st data-num="3614" class="">house</st> of a <st data-num="5100" class="">person</st> <st data-num="3686" class="">named</st> <st data-num="5102">Titius</st> <st data-num="2459" class="">Justus</st>, a Gentile who <st data-num="4576" class="">worshiped</st> <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st>,<n id="4" /> <st data-num="3739" class="">whose</st> <st data-num="3614" class="">house</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">was</st> <st data-num="4927">next door</st> to the <st data-num="4864" class="">synagogue</st>.

<st data-num="2921" class="">Crispus</st>, the <st data-num="752">president of the synagogue</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="4100" class="">believed</st> in the <st data-num="2962" class="">Lord</st> <st data-num="4862">together with</st> <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="3650" class="">entire</st> <st data-num="3624" class="">household</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="4183" class="">many</st> of the <st data-num="2881" class="">Corinthians</st> who <st data-num="191" class="">heard</st> about it<n id="2" /> <st data-num="4100" class="">believed</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> were <st data-num="907" class="">baptized</st>.

The <st data-num="2962" class="">Lord</st> <st data-num="3004">said</st> to <st data-num="3972" class="">Paul</st> <st data-num="1223" class="">by</st> a <st data-num="3705" class="">vision</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="3571" class="">night</st>,<n id="2" /> “Do <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> <st data-num="5399">be afraid</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="235" class="">but</st> <st data-num="2980" class="">speak</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> do <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="4623" class="">silent</st>

<st data-num="1360" class="">because</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">I</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">am</st> <st data-num="3326" class="">with</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="3762">no one</st> will <st data-num="2007" class="">assault</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> to <st data-num="2559" class="">harm</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> <st data-num="1360" class="">because</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">I</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">have</st> <st data-num="4183" class="">many</st> <st data-num="2992" class="">people</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> <st data-num="3778" class="">this</st> <st data-num="4172" class="">city</st>.”
So he stayed there a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.
Now while Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews attacked Paul together and brought him before the judgment seat,

<st data-num="3004" class="">saying</st>, “<st data-num="3778" class="">This man</st> is <st data-num="374" class="">persuading</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="444" class="">people</st> to <st data-num="4576" class="">worship</st> <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st> in a way <st data-num="3844" class="">contrary</st> to<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="3551" class="">law</st>!”

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> just as <st data-num="3972" class="">Paul</st> was <st data-num="3195" class="">about</st> to <st data-num="455 4750">speak</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="1058" class="">Gallio</st> <st data-num="3004">said</st> <st data-num="4314" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews</st>, “<st data-num="1487">If</st> it <st data-num="1510" class="">were</st> a <st data-num="5100">matter of some</st> <st data-num="92" class="">crime</st> <st data-num="2228" class="">or</st> <st data-num="4190" class="">serious</st> <st data-num="4467">piece of villainy</st>,<n id="2" /> I would have been <st data-num="430" class="">justified</st> in <st data-num="2596" class="">accepting</st> the <st data-num="3056" class="">complaint</st><n id="3" /> of <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews</st>,<n id="4" />

<st data-num="1161" class="">but</st> <st data-num="1487">since</st> it <st data-num="1510">concerns</st> points of <st data-num="2213" class="">disagreement</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="4012" class="">about</st> <st data-num="3056" class="">words</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="3686" class="">names</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">your own</st> <st data-num="3551" class="">law</st>, <st data-num="3708">settle</st><n id="2" /> it <st data-num="846" class="">yourselves</st>. <st data-num="1473" class="">I</st> <st data-num="1014" class="">will</st> <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">be</st><n id="3" /> a <st data-num="2923" class="">judge</st> of <st data-num="3778">these things</st>!”

<st data-num="2532" class="">Then</st> he had <st data-num="846" class="">them</st> <st data-num="556">forced away</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="575" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="968">judgment seat</st>.<n id="2" />
So they all seized Sosthenes, the president of the synagogue, and began to beat him in front of the judgment seat. Yet none of these things were of any concern to Gallio.

Paul, after staying many more days in Corinth, said farewell to the brothers and sailed away to Syria accompanied by Priscilla and Aquila. He had his hair cut off at Cenchrea because he had made a vow.

When they <st data-num="2658" class="">reached</st> <st data-num="2181" class="">Ephesus</st>,<n id="1" /> Paul<n id="2" /> <st data-num="2641" class="">left</st> <st data-num="2548">Priscilla and Aquila</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="2641" class="">behind</st> <st data-num="847" class="">there</st>, <st data-num="1161" class="">but</st> he <st data-num="846" class="">himself</st> <st data-num="1525" class="">went</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="1519" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="4864" class="">synagogue</st><n id="5" /> and <st data-num="1256" class="">addressed</st><n id="6" /> the <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews</st>.

When <st data-num="846" class="">they</st> <st data-num="2065" class="">asked</st> him to <st data-num="3306" class="">stay</st> <st data-num="4183 5550">longer</st>, he would <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="1962" class="">consent</st>,<n id="1" />

<st data-num="235" class="">but</st> <st data-num="657">said farewell</st> to<n id="1" /> them <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="3004">added</st>,<n id="2" /> “I will <st data-num="344">come back</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="4314" class="">to</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> <st data-num="3825" class="">again</st> if <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st> <st data-num="2309" class="">wills</st>.”<n id="4" /> Then<n id="5" /> he <st data-num="321">set sail</st> <st data-num="575" class="">from</st> <st data-num="2181" class="">Ephesus</st>,

<st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> when he <st data-num="2718" class="">arrived</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1519" class="">at</st> <st data-num="2542" class="">Caesarea</st>,<n id="2" /> he <st data-num="305">went up</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="782" class="">greeted</st><n id="3" /> the <st data-num="1577" class="">church</st> at Jerusalem<n id="4" /> and then <st data-num="2597">went down</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">to</st> <st data-num="490" class="">Antioch</st>.<n id="5" />
After he spent some time there, Paul left and went through the region of Galatia and Phrygia, strengthening all the disciples.
Now a Jew named Apollos, a native of Alexandria, arrived in Ephesus. He was an eloquent speaker, well-versed in the scriptures.

<st data-num="3778" class="">He</st> had <st data-num="1510" class="">been</st> <st data-num="2727" class="">instructed</st> in<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="3598" class="">way</st> of the <st data-num="2962" class="">Lord</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> with <st data-num="2204 4151">great enthusiasm</st><n id="2" /> he <st data-num="2980" class="">spoke</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1321" class="">taught</st> <st data-num="199" class="">accurately</st> the <st data-num="3588" class="">facts</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="4012" class="">about</st> <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st>, although he <st data-num="1987" class="">knew</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="3441">only</st> the <st data-num="908" class="">baptism</st> of <st data-num="2491" class="">John</st>.

<st data-num="3778" class="">He</st> <st data-num="757">began</st> to <st data-num="3955" class="">speak out fearlessly</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="4864" class="">synagogue</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="1161" class="">but</st> when <st data-num="4251">Priscilla</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="207" class="">Aquila</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="191" class="">heard</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>, they <st data-num="4355" class="">took</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="4355" class="">aside</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1620" class="">explained</st> the <st data-num="3598" class="">way</st> of <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st> to <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="196">more accurately</st>.

When <st data-num="846" class="">Apollos</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1014" class="">wanted</st> to <st data-num="1330">cross over</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">to</st> <st data-num="882" class="">Achaia</st>,<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="80" class="">brothers</st> <st data-num="4389" class="">encouraged</st><n id="3" /> him<n id="4" /> and <st data-num="1125" class="">wrote</st> to the <st data-num="3101" class="">disciples</st> to <st data-num="588" class="">welcome</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>. When <st data-num="3739">he</st> <st data-num="3854" class="">arrived</st>, he<n id="5" /> <st data-num="4820" class="">assisted</st> <st data-num="4183" class="">greatly</st> those who had <st data-num="4100" class="">believed</st> <st data-num="1223" class="">by</st> <st data-num="5485" class="">grace</st>,
for he refuted the Jews vigorously in public debate, demonstrating from the scriptures that the Christ was Jesus.
